feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the formula configured in leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is not actively used. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is no synchronized mechanism for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. The system requires manual alignment and does not provide automatic formula inheritance or synchronization.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Year
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. When calculating End of Service (EOS) gratuity, the system fails to recognize 2024 as a leap year, causing a calculation discrepancy of approximately AED 17.26.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation does not automatically adjust for leap years, leading to potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: The daily wage calculator lacks dynamic leap year handling in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations. The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) differs from manual calculation (AED 252,485), with support explaining the system calculation follows a specific service duration and daily wage formula
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex service duration splitting and tiered daily rates
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential complexity in handling precise gratuity calculations across different service periods

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Handling Leap Year Day Correctly
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently account for February 29th in leap years, causing a minor discrepancy in total service days calculation (912 vs 913 days). The difference impacts the final gratuity amount calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Days Calculation in Gratuity Computation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates total job tenure with a potential extra day (623 days instead of 622 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculations. The discrepancy stems from how working days are counted and converted to years.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor inconsistency in days worked calculation can result in fractional year differences
known_issues.gap_statement: Precision in days calculation needs review to ensure exact working days are captured

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary using a fixed daily rate divisor (potentially 30 days) which may not accurately reflect calendar month variations. User expected calculation based on 31 days, but system used a different configuration.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configuration, which may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days variation impacts leave salary accrual consistency
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to different prorated amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match user's initial expectation

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in handling dynamic proration scenarios for payroll calculations

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: Public holiday additions after leave request creation cause mismatches between HR and Payroll systems' daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deductions. The Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to the Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holidays are added after leave requests are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across different system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct. This is a display bug in the remarks field where the wrong number of days is referenced.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy calculations, potentially causing incorrect salary deductions by using gross salary instead of basic salary.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically supersede policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not consistently reflect the leave occurrence month's rate
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is calculated based on a standard of 26 working days per month, derived from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Employees' salaries are standardized to a 26-day working month, with no built-in flexibility for actual attendance variations

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations. The leave policy formula becomes non-editable (greyed out) when payroll settings are configured.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculator in payroll settings first to ensure correct unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Config Dependency in Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce results that are 0.1 or 0.2 less than expected, affecting all employees' End of Service calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in employee final settlements

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are only accrued at the end of the month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically claim leave days for the incomplete month

limitations.title: Service Duration Day Counting Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculation

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows predefined policy configurations that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify daily wage calculation method to match their specific expectations or month-specific nuances.

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Method Constraints
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculator uses working days as default calculation method, which causes monthly variations in leave salary accrual amounts
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary totals will differ month-to-month based on working days count

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies between leave salary and salary proration

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration calculation may differ from traditional calendar day assumptions

limitations.title: Limited Proration Logic for Future Departure Dates
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with upcoming departure dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot reliably manage payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have status changes.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to resolve.

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Precise daily wage calculation depends on accurate public holiday and working days configuration

limitations.title: Custom Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll system uses 30.42 days as divisor for daily wage calculation, not standard calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not precisely match expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on actual calendar days in the month, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Precise unpaid leave deductions require accurate daily rate calculation using the exact number of days in each month

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inability to automatically prorate salary for varying work days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current payroll system lacks automated attendance-based salary calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent daily wage formula display between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings intentionally override leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings; check that salary components and divisor (number of days) are correctly configured

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the leave request and recreate it if deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Gratuity amount lower than expected due to incorrect day count
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses fixed 365-day year instead of recognizing 366 days in leap years
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust calculation to use 366 days for leap years when computing service period

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service calculations show incorrect pro-rated amounts
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify and manually adjust final settlement amounts to account for the systematic 0.1 or 0.2 decimal undercalculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between system and manual gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Complex calculation involving service duration split and different daily rates for different service periods
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust EOS balance in the system or verify calculation details with support

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and calculated leave salary amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may use a fixed daily rate divisor
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand the specific divisor used for salary calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected differences in monthly leave salary accrual totals
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, which recalculates daily rate based on monthly working days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use 'custom days' setting for leave encashments to maintain consistent calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatched leave salary calculation compared to expected amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different daily wage divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or adjust calculation method to use consistent divisor

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's assigned work week policy and confirm if all 7 days are marked as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed instead of prorated amount for offboarded employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic fails to handle departure dates relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary based on days worked (Daily rate = Monthly salary / 30 * Days worked)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate payroll deductions persist after leave request modification or deletion
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Synchronization failure between leave management and payroll deduction systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual intervention required to remove orphaned or duplicate deductions from payroll

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Timing mismatch between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are added
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual deduction adjustment or reopening previous payroll cycles (not recommended)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Deduction amount differs from expected monthly salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses 30.42 days divisor: Daily wage = 4300/30.42 = 141.35, Total Deduction = 141.35 * 31 = 4,381.99
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Understand that system uses custom days divisor for precise daily wage calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between displayed daily rate and actual calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation uses correct 29 days for February, but remarks field incorrectly shows 31 days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount against the calculated daily rate, not the remarks text

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected salary deductions during unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overriding policy-specific calculation methods
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global unpaid leave daily rate settings and understand their precedence over policy-level configurations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System recalculates daily rate based on payroll processing month instead of storing original leave occurrence month rate
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: A fix was deployed to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount, avoiding recalculation

claims_to_validate.statement: Platform calculates total job tenure with a potential extra day (623 days instead of 622 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculations. The discrepancy stems from how working days are counted and converted to years.

claims_to_validate.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary using a fixed daily rate divisor (potentially 30 days) which may not accurately reflect calendar month variations. User expected calculation based on 31 days, but system used a different configuration.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to different prorated amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. The system only correctly prorates salaries when departure dates are in the past.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: Public holiday additions after leave request creation cause mismatches between HR and Payroll systems' daily wage calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deductions. The Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to the Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in remarks for February unpaid leave deduction, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct. This is a display bug in the remarks field where the wrong number of days is referenced.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy calculations, potentially causing incorrect salary deductions by using gross salary instead of basic salary.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Incorrectly Displayed
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is calculated based on a standard of 26 working days per month, derived from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days divided by 12 months.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations. The leave policy formula becomes non-editable (greyed out) when payroll settings are configured.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Dependency in Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
claims_to_validate.statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years in service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce results that are 0.1 or 0.2 less than expected, affecting all employees' End of Service calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are only accrued at the end of the month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Service Duration Day Counting Rules
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled

claims_to_validate.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows predefined policy configurations that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Method Constraints
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculator uses working days as default calculation method, which causes monthly variations in leave salary accrual amounts

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Proration Logic for Future Departure Dates
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future dates

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling in Leave Transactions
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot reliably manage payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have status changes.

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

claims_to_validate.title: Custom Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll system uses 30.42 days as divisor for daily wage calculation, not standard calendar days

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations are based on actual calendar days in the month, with specific handling required for months with varying days (especially February in leap years).
